*Behe, Darwin’s Black Box, 73.



497
Scientific Revolutions
We are beguiled by the simple story line Behe rehearses. He invites us to
consider the situation by supposing that the flagellum requires the introduc-
tion  of  some  number—20,  say—of  proteins  that  the  ancestral  bacterium
doesn’t originally have. So Darwinians have to produce a sequence of 21 or-
